Review title: There ain't nothing finer then a chick with guns.
Review_body: I saw this movie opening weekend. It was my first date. With out any prior knowledge to what the movie was about I thought that it would be some type of romantic comedy staring Meg Ryan and Tom Hanks. Boy was I wrong. To my relief it was one of the best action movies of 1996. Sure, it has its faults. I won't give any spoilers. Let me just say ith T2 being almost 4 years old when this was released I think it was good timing for a leading Female action role. Both Davis and Jackson pulled their role off very well. 8/10

Let me start by saying overall I enjoyed The Long Kiss Goodnight. I would give it a 7/10. The Good: 1. Acting: Samuel L Jackson is entertaining in almost any role. In this movie he doesn't play his usual character, the type that is in control, instead Geena Davis is in control and Sam is along for the ride. His timing on his lines are great and he is the high point of the movie. Geena Davis also gives a great preformance as Samantha Caine/Charlie Baltimore. She is a believable action hero and I don't think too many other actresses could pull off the preformance Geena Does. 2. The Action: This is a very action packed movie. Things are pretty much always crashing or blowing up or someone is chasing someone else. The special effects are pretty good especially for being almost 8 years old. I can see some green screen stuff but it doesn't detract too much from the acting.The Bad: 1. Why did it take half of the movie to set up the plot? This film needed to be edited in the script stage so that it didn't run as long as it did. Maybe a drama or something can run this long but people really need to be into the movie the entire time to sustain it. I think that if you can stick out the first half you will be pleseantly suprized the second half. 2. Geena Davis is cold weather and a tank top but she never seems cold. 3. Some things are unrealistic. Sam Jackson flies through a giant sign after he is blasted out of a room and then he lands in a tree and just gets up. When you see this part you will think it's a gag. overall fun movie 7/10

This is by far my favorite action movie. But what makes it work is not the elaborate Renny Harlin explosions and shoot-em-ups. It's the Shane Black script and its deft delivery by Geena Davis and Samuel L. Jackson.The chemistry between the two principals merited a sequel. Thank God it was never made. Too much danger of marring the original.'The Long Kiss' checkerboards from quotable scene to action scene to quotable scene and back again. Never a dull moment. This has to be Jackson's funniest role ever, and the amazing thing is that he is playing one of the most normal characters of his career. No quirky Tarantino hit-man, super-cool Shaft, or borderline psycho soldier. In TLKG, Jackson is the everyman we identify with. The poor schmuck gets dragged along on this crazy woman's odyssey to uncover the dangerous secret of her past.Though the story claims that Davis's character, Samantha Caine is suffering from amnesia, the writer and director treat her condition as if it were a multiple personality disorder.Samantha Caine is not just a new identity taken by the amnesiac Charly Baltimore -- she is a separate, fully-developed personality. The traumas suffered by Samantha in the first half-hour of the movie help the submerged dissociate personality of Charly to emerge again.The materials of her past life excavated by Jackson's detective Mitch Henessey facilitate Charly's resurfacing. Good timing, too, considering the target Samantha makes of herself.But Charly has to fight herself to remain the dominant personality. One gathers from bits of dialogue that the warrior personality (Charly) developed after her father died and she was recruited by the "Chapter".In the eight years Charly was buried in the psyche, though, her Samantha identity developed into the dominant personality. (She's even funnier that Charly.) This was probably due to becoming a mother, because it's the reunion with her daughter that breaks Charly's struggle to suppress Samantha, leading to their apparent integration by movie's end.It's impossible to choose a "best quote" from this film:"Now you're a sharpshooter?""I saved your ass. It was great!""Continue dying. Out.""I sock 'em in the jaw and yell 'Pop goes the weasel'".And a couple of dozen more, many too raunchy to quote here.Geena Davis looks great, and comes off as an action hero without glossing over the fact she's turning forty. (Listen to Charley's history, do the math).Fantastic soundtrack, too. Santana, Muddy Waters, Elvis, LaBelle, Marvin Gaye. I give 'The Long Kiss Goodnight' a 9, only because I don't believe in a perfect 10. Seen it a dozen times, and it still stays fresh. Nice twisted holiday flick to place on your shelf next to 'It's A Wonderful Life.'

I had seen it before, and liked it.  Just saw it again, and I liked it some more.  If I recall correctly, this film didn't do too well in theaters, but I'm not sure why.  It's got some great action and Samuel L. Jackson.  What more could you ask for?  Ok, well, the story is just okay - the whole government trained assassin is kind of common, but I thought the amnesia angle was fairly clever.  Some parts of the story were hokey, and the villains weren't much to talk about.  But, still, very entertaining film. And I wouldn't mind giving Geena Davis a long kiss goodnight.

Review title: A fun romp that is worth the time
Review_body: I have a blast watching this movie.  The lines are witty, the chemistry is fun to watch and is not forced, and the story line is "believable" in the sense of the classic spy movie.  I would love to see a sequel of this movie, though I know that will never happen, I would be first in line to watch.

Ahh, Geena...I'm probably one of the few who liked Geena more with dark hair over blonde.  My first thought when seeing the poster and the previews was "Man, she looks kinda creepy with that blonde hair."  Turns out there's a good reason.Anyway, this was a fun action movie.  Lots of gunplay, a fairly straightforward plot, a little bit of "MacGuyver" improvisation, and the team of Geena Davis (one of my own personal Dream Women, so excuse me if I'm a little biased) and Samuel L. Jackson.  One of the things that also struck me about this movie is that Davis and Jackson have some of the better lines I've heard in an action movie - very witty.If you're looking for a cerebral, touching, or meaningful film, keep looking.  On the other hand, if you're looking for some Government Conspiracy Lite, people shooting at each other, and stuff blowing up, you could do a lot worse than "The Long Kiss Goodnight."

Saw this film on TV just now for the first time in ages and realised what makes it so good...SAMUEL L. JACKSON'S WARDROBE.Throughout the film, Sam sports a frizzy lime-green bunnet, a dark green blazer, a checked green suit, and a yellow-green polo-neck sweater.  No Oscar for costume design?The scene where Geena Davis pushes him out of the car after realising she doesn't need him any longer is great - he simply lies in the middle of the road with a world-weary expression and lights up, oblivious to the cars speeding by or the undeniable pain in his back.  Fantastic.Great action, explosions and shoot-outs, just what you'd expect from the man Renny, and a hilarious script by Shane Black.  RECOMMENDED!

When this movie came out, I had seen Geena Davis play only soft, feminine roles... This movie was anything but soft and feminine.  Great lines, great action...she and Samuel L really clicked.  Too violent for the kiddies, but if you and your significant other are trying to agree on a movie, try this one on for size.  Go Geena! Go Geena!

Review title: Can I give it less than a 1 rating?
Review_body: I definitely have to speak to my sister about her recommending this film to me.  The Long Kiss Goodnight definitely makes my Top 10 list.................for WORST movies ever made.This was a terrible movie with over-done stunts and explosions.  I'm sure Samuel Jackson, who I think is a great actor, must have had second thoughts about this flick after it was completed.  Oh well, all actors have a dud once in a while.As for Geena Davis, let's hope that her ventures into TV are more successful than her last few movie roles.I'm afraid that The Last Kiss gets the big "Kiss-off" from this reviewer.

I'm a Geena Davis fan for life because of this movie. I've always loved Samuel L Jackson. And the two make a great pair on screen. This said, I think 'TLKG' is the best action movie I've ever seen, forget the twist endings that audiences have now come to expect and that filmmakers now try (mostly failing) to incorporate into their movies.10/10

It's over the top, the story is not holding much water, but, boy, it's a ride. This might be just one of the top 5 action movies of the 90s and certainly among the top 3 roles for Jackson, Brian Cox and Geena Davis.Jackson's turn as viciously ill-dressed cop turned con turned seedy private eye with a heart of gold may only be second to his Pulp Fiction cult status performance. Geena Davis' appearance not only shows that she could act on a script that plays to her strengths but also works as a competent action heroine. Cox, who curiously played a rather similar role years later in the Bourne Identity and Bourne Supremacy, gets some dialogue that most actors would kill for.Suspend your disbelief and enjoy it, it's worth the rental fee or DVD purchasing price.

Charmless, dim, and entirely unloveable action trash with an unsympathetic protagonist, a style-free script and a pair of non-actor leads . . . but what about its bad points?Mainly, it lacks the sense of the ridiculous that makes many equally silly actioners (eg the Terminators, Die Hards, Lethal Weapons, etc) far more enjoyable. Any humour it possesses comes in the form of crude wisecracks and comedy violence, while it plays its puerile scenario and story-line with dog-faced seriousness. On the side of positive unpleasantness, much of the action appeals to sheer sadism - one sequence combines torture with a wet-lingerie show - and there's something not far from fascism in the way it assumes our unquestioning willingness to root for a government assassin.
None of this is helped by Geena Davis's perky, smug punchability or Samuel L Jackson's standard recreation of a groovy-black-perp supporting role from an old episode of Kojak, but better performances by more likeable players would have been a waste of talent and craft. That Long Kiss Goodnight died at the cinemas like a louse in a hobo's beard is the only remotely enjoyable thing about it - it suggests that it's still possible to lose money by insulting the public's intelligence.

This film is not to be taken too seriously. There are plot holes, cheesy and dated special effects, and several moments where you just shake your head wondering what the director was thinking. But despite those things it has some very well thought out and executed action scenes, where they went the extra mile to make it look cool (shotgun fired at a fridge door, bad guy on fire dangling from a string of lights, etc.). Great lines from Sam Jackson, surely improvised. Genna Davis pulls off the dual personality with style. Many laugh out loud moments, whether they were intended or not. A fun film overall.

Review title: Great throw back to the old Mae West comedies
Review_body: A spy, thought for dead, but in reality alive, and suffering from amnesia, buys her cover story as her true reality and goes about life as a PTA volunteer/ homemaker for 8 years, before a bump on her head and a chance encounter with a past target, trigger memories of her earlier life as a top secret government assassin (Bourne Identity anyone?). Great pairing between Davis and Jackson, whose back and forth banter is a great throw back to the old Mae West comedies:Samantha: Easy, sport. I got myself outta Beirut once, I think I can get outta New Jersey.Mitch: Yeah? Well, don't be so sure. Others have tried and failed. The entire population, in fact.

Review title: If you haven't seen this already, you're not missing anything.
Review_body: This film, which by reading the summary (I know, we all hate reading summaries for thrillers, but we all still do) could potentially be understood as at least semi-good, is ruined by 3 key aspects.First, the script is naive and offers us that our lead lady, who is an amnesiac (for 8 years), when finally confronted with her past, changes her personality completely around (amnesia and reminiscences are portrayed here exactly how schizophrenia is usually portrayed in movies). She starts out as a caring mother and domestic wife and then turns into a ruthless, vicious, slutty assassin. There is an abundance of holes in the thriller part as well, but the stated fact, makes the entire movie look ridiculous and childish.Second, to top the first problem, this role is portrayed by Geena Davis. Who is completely unconvincing and pale (mostly as the second 'personality'  Charlie). At times when she is changing and turning her personality 180, we get some 'The Exorcist' (loosely) style changes in her facial expression, voice and language used.Third, to completely bury this movie is the directing. The director, obviously couldn't decide where and how to take the thriller approach, together with the action-flick approach, and also the drama-approach. Instead of doing one of these averagely, he fails on all three, and we have a mushy final result, which doesn't look like anything categorizable (which can be very good, but this is not the case here).Samuel L. Jackson plays 'the sidekick'. I find it offensive, that he as the only black member of the cast, gets pushed around, slapped and even kicked out of a car (his friend, Geena Davis, uses her leg to push him out of a moving jeep because she 'don't need him anymore).

Maybe Renny Harlin's best flick so far, this movie is a school book example of how to make a good popcorn action thriller.A school teacher in the form of Harlin's wife at the time, Geena Davis, suffers from amnesia hires a small town private dec (Samuel L Jackson, a standard Harlin choice ever since) to investigate her past. Suddenly unconscious flashbacks start to reveal her violent past and the results her detective friends presents gets more and more curious. Finally the past catches up, when an assassination attempt at her is made at her home. Jackson & Davis continue an action packed adventure filled with things blowing up, guns blasting and knives flying, leading all the way to a secret CIA mission and the kidnapping of Davis' daughter.The film is very well executed and acting is superb. Davis, at the time best known from Thelma & Louise and Fields of Glory, is a top notch choice as slightly the schizophrenic wimpy school teacher/coldblooded assassin. She carries out the role with grace and a lot of balls, and apart from many female action stars, this girl can actually act. Jackson is rarely a bad choice for anything, and even though his performance might not be worthy of an Oscar, he adds a second dimension to the film.The script might be a bit cheesy at times, and uses every cliché in the action dictionary, but carries it out with style. The film keeps you on the edge of your seat at all times, though the middle part is a bit dreary. The ending climax is a masterpiece of action filming. Let's hope Harlin's upcoming collaboration with Jackson is equally nice.Respect the Humpp!

This film was of great interest to me because of the action it comtained and it's content.  Iliked the characters of Mitch Hennesy, the tough private detective and Charly Baltimore, the character portrayed by Geena Davies. The story was good and, although a bit contrived, very watchable and deep.

I have watched this movie on LD at least 30 times -- obviously it's one of my favorites. Geena Davis is awesome, and Jackson is perfect and funny in his role. The plot is simple but good, the action terrific and the physics impossible.I understand that this movie and Cutthroat Island killed Geena Davis's career. What a shame, because both movies are terrific.There is no sex or gore in the film, but the language and intense violence makes in unsuitable for young children.Geena plays a teacher with amnesia, who's really a CIA assasin. When the bad guys find her, the action begins, and never really lets up. Sit tight, and turn your brain off just a bit for maximum enjoyment.5 stars.

Review title: Best action flick of all time
Review_body: This is my favorite movie of all time! Our stars are awesome in this movie, the action terrific, and the special effects pretty good. The dialog is what makes the movie, though. Comic book lines, to be sure -- but they work! I don't know how many times I've watched this flick on LD and DVD, 30 or 40? Who cares, I'm watching it again this weekend!

SPOILERS -- I just saw this movie on cable, and I was stunned how much the seemingly "unique" and "signature" hand-to-hand combat action sequences of the Bourne Supremacy series films (which post-date this one) are similar to the action in this terrific film. Check out the first such scene where Gena defeats at home, against overwhelming odds, an anonymous attacker who's armed with a powerful weapon. Gena gets realistically knocked around, just like Jason, is very unexpectedly creative at critical moments (throwing her kid through a hole in the wall to save her) just like Jason, uses and throws household items (including a refrigerator door, kitchen supplies and a pie) against the attacker to fend him off just like Jason, and ultimately displays incredible personal combat and killing skills that come out of nowhere related to her amnesia, just like Jason. I'm sort of bummed, because until I saw this great action movie, the Bourne films struck me as being really different and creative in this respect. Guess not. OK, no one does car chases like the Bourne crew, but this film was an eye-opener at what a trend-setter Harlin was. Or maybe not. I'm sure somebody out there will be more than happy to tell me who Harlin "allegedly" copied for his personal combat sequences . . .

I could keep mum if there were just one flaw, but this movie is right from the stinkiest of the gutters. However, it's got variety - yeah, variety of crap - all kinds of it, ranging from the lead character getting too lucky with the enemy's bullets, unnecessary characters (Samuel Jackson), people getting shot in the chest and still getting up screaming ready to fight, clownish CIA operatives throwing punch lines at each other, no cops in sight throughout the movie despite several shoot-outs and grenade explosions at major commercial places, lead characters walking calmly (as if on a ramp in a fashion show) out of a shoot-out scene right in the middle of a busy city street. Hey, but that's not all. The director was at his best in this movie. You even got enemy carrying a handgun and rifle charging at the lead character, I guess, trying to hit her on the head with the pistol, instead of shooting her with it from a safe distance. Maybe that's a better way to kill. What do I know?I mean what the hell!!! My dog could direct a better movie than this while pissing on the neighbor's car tire. Shame on all the people involved in this movie project. Poor acting. Poor screenplay. Poor direction.

Review title: A movie that is senseless even to the crazy
Review_body: My idea of a crazy action movie was never that it should not make sense. And yes I enjoy James Bond running around with girls and jumping from a cliff to catch an airplane. Although I did enjoy those films, I always rated it 1 out of 10 because they did not make sense. The difference with this film is although it did not make sense it was not enjoyable either. I just read a review of this film which was talking about woman assertiveness, little child not giving up etc etc which is absolutely stupid, insensitive and naive.This movie had a very good theme of a lady who went into amnesia, then coming back to her past. That was a wonderful catch and there were few screens where I was totally bought. Then when the violence began, I was all excited and was thrilled to see a woman playing such a daring role and it was very very very impressive. "Samantha" who came to her past had a trouble loving her child etc and movie was good only until this part.Now starts the actual aura of stupidity. The director was unable to continue the strength of the movie so far he/she has build up. There is something in life called a full stop ( period). Come on, the violence goes on and on and the kid is dragged into this. And the kid is not shocked with all the violence and blood and during the last few minutes the kid is not even hurt, then she calls out for her mother etc etc.. is stupid. Actually entirely stupid. The portrayal of heroism has been dragged to an extent that the viewer at some point of time realizes that this is not making sense and what the hell he/she is watching. The blast at the very end, previous firings etc on Mitch and Sam do not end and they still survive, the kid is not horrified etc.. will actually open new doors to dumbness in every viewer.Call from president is the ultimatum in dumbness and I wanted to take a decision that I would stop watching movies altogether but rather I would write a dumb script myself and make a movie out of it and rather be rich. 2.5 hrs of my time taught a precious thing today. Totally disappointed.

Review title: great movie that you can watch over
Review_body: complete nonsense done with great style and excess. better than 'bourne' because it has humour and the story isn't banal. edges 'diehard 3' (forget the rest of that series) because it has two unusual heroes and one of them is a women (yes I know that SJ is in both). good story (although silly at end - Hollywood) with very good script and very good leads. bad guys are bad, the in-betweeners don't last long and the good guys are both good and bad. if only they could make nonsense with such humour and style these days.......... perhaps even once every five years. if only (again) the 'has been' and 'want to be' genre movies could achieve this level of proficiency and entertainment. always a favourite and way beyond the average rating in IMDb. don't believe the nay sayers, particularly the professional media who don't rate it. they clearly do not understand the genre nor are they interested in watching this kind of stuff - they have to! go watch it!

Review title: The perfect blend of Action, Suspense, Drama and Comedy
Review_body: I hadn't planned on leaving a review, but seeing some of the other dreadful reviews for this movie, I had to say something.I'm not going to give away the ending or anything, but I do give away some important plot points in this review, so you should be aware of that. The short (non-spoiler) version of my review - Samuel L. Jackson and Geena Davis both kick butt in this movie, and it's a lot of fun. Watch it.This movie is one of my favorites of all time. Geena Davis is perfect as the action heroine, torn between her existing life as a housewife and mother, and the memories that are resurfacing of her former life as a CIA Assassin. Her performance is superb as she plays both facets of this relatively complex character perfectly.Samuel L. Jackson's performance is, as always, also excellent, as the Private Investigator that Geena Davis' character hired to look into her forgotten past. He does a great job of playing the unwitting sidekick to Geena Davis' tough character. Some of the lines he utters in this movie are the best he's ever used in any movie he's been in.Seriously, if you haven't seen it, do. It's a fantastic story with lots of unexpected twists and turns, and it's extremely well directed and acted.

Honestly, the synopsis and most reviews dont do this movie justice, this is a fun, action packed, great Shane Black movie. Its a good time, the writing is tight and follows its internal logic/rules, even when its a little silly at times.

Review title: The best action dialogues I've ever known
Review_body: That was really one of the best action movies I've ever seen. And the dialogues are really good. Of course as any action film it resembles fantasy from time to time. But what the hell! This is really an excellent movie. You want to have fun and tickle your nerves? Watch it!

I was so excited when this movie came out, it had such promise but the movie was seriously disappointing.  Firstly when Samuel.L Jackson and Geena Davis were running through the train station as several guys firing there automatic weapons at them from point blank range with nothing in the way was beyond a joke.  The action and events throughout the movie was simply slow and average.  Most of all I thought all directors knew that the viewing public are sick of the "I thought you were dead" hero routine because I became furious when Samuel instead of having a heroic death comes back with cornball Hollywood style.

Review title: How Many Times Can Trained Gunman Miss Their Target?
Review_body: I went into this film hoping for a suspenseful plot with a lot of action. I was not disappointed with the action. However, the plot was a tired James Bond type formula with a twist. The twist was there was a woman as the star who can always shoot or think her way out of any situation, no matter how preposterous. The problem for me was that the plot became so incredible that only the special effects were interesting. Yet, it was easy to watch from a "no-brainer" perspective. If you are looking for a movie to challenge your wits, forget this. But if you have home theatre, want to watch action and listen to explosions... pop some popcorn and rent this.

Review title: The worst movie I have seen in years!
Review_body: This has to be one of the reasons why I don't go to the cinema any more. If you want American rubbish, this is it in spades. This film will appeal to people with an IQ of zero. The action sequences are about the only thing in this movie the Director seems to be able to handle,the rest is like watching traffic go by.The script is ridiculous,the heroine is dead one minute,alive the next,dead again etc. Samuel Jackson is a talented actor, but even he can't salvage garbage. Davis is an crazed assassin,then a loving Mother,how is it going to play when she gets back to normality? The answer is too pathetic for words.There is no real characterisation in this film,just a series of violent and nasty events. Films like this are becoming all too common in American cinema,shove in a couple of stars, a big budget for special effects,and hope the public won't notice the silly storyline and the banal dialogue. Geena Davis is suffering from memory loss;quite right,I forgot all about this junk one minute after it finished.
Absolutely stupendous! What a movie night find. How have we ever missed this? Worthy of buying it for our DVD library, to rewatch anytime.

Review title: Geena proves she's a class act action star
Review_body: For action movie fans this is one to see and it has a very decent plot for a film in this genre.  But the real reason to see this film is to watch Geena in a role type she was born to play - The Action Hero.  Cutthroat Island only gave a brief glimpse of her brilliant take on this type of role but this film gives Geena the chance to show us a tough, gritty, confident and very sexy action figure and she shines brightly. Samuel Jackson is Geena's unwilling sidekick and, as such, provides a good taut believable performance. I don't think I've ever seen a file of his that I haven't liked; can you? One more comment: I hope to see GD in more roles like this.

When I first saw this movie I got excited by the action and missed some other important factors, like the political issue and the mother - daughter relationship, also there still remains the important matter about this kind of special agents trained by someone, who can freak - out in any minute and make a killing just like that. Is not that something to think about?.Any way please do see this movie, it is not Rambo - Girl but improved special effects can make you feel also a beautiful woman can be more than a "Lethal Weapon".Thank God the FBI is not really the turk they seem in this movie

Review title: How did this movie get a 6.8?
Review_body: It deserves much higher. This is an amazing action movie. I have watched this at least 10 times if not much more, and every time it is pure enjoyment.

This movie is absolutely terrible and I can't refrain from watching it when it's on because it's so bad. It has to be one of the most over the top movies I have ever seen. The explosions are ridiculously huge, the situations are totally unbelievable to the point of being stupid and don't even get me started on the acting. At one point I almost expect Geena Davis to come out with the line "Christina! Bring me the axe!" You'll know it when you see it. I get that suspension of disbelief is a major part of watching action movies but some ask you to do it a lot more than others. The action in The Bourne Identity or a film like Ronin, while exaggerated, is for the most part possible in real life, just not very likely. The action in this film however is almost cartoonish. But that's what makes it so great.If you like a clichéd, over the top action movie with equally over the top acting from the lead you'll probably like this. I had to give it 7 stars for pure entertainment value.

I first saw this movie about three years ago and I don't know how many times since, but it never fails to entertain me.    It was good to see a strong female action role, Geena Davis was excellent as the PTA mother and deadly assassin.  Samuel Jackson, well what can I say, he is a very talented and gifted actor who can deliver drama, action and comedy .. But then I'm biased I always enjoys his roles regardless.Both actors looked as though they enjoyed making this movie, but then they had a great story-line, with loads of action and one-liners.

Grab the popcorn, sit comfortably on the sofa, and forget the real world exists. This movie is the perfect example of escapism -- good writing allows you to be engaged with the characters and laugh at the occasional jokes sprinkled throughout the movie (including in the middle of serious scenes, which helps keep things light).This is not a movie to watch with small children around. Language, blood, gun play, explosions, brief backside nudity, etc. For adults, this is a classic late 90s action movie. Not much in the way of a plot but who cares? Great dialog, jokes, and with Geena and Samuel, great leads. This is a fun watch.

Review title: Amnesiac Geena Davis goes tough long before the Bourne Identity
Review_body: When I first saw this movie, I was stunned by Geena Davis' transformation from soccer mom to assassin. In the 10 years since it came out, I have either been hardened or have grown up, because it just views like sheer entertainment. I think it was ahead of its time, and would do better if released today.I remember being the most shocked by Davis' screamed epithet at the climax. Now it's just witty, more than anything else.Here's the irony -- the same guy that mentored her was the government benefactor of Treadstone in the Bourne Identity, which had a similar premise. Come to think of it, this must be a direct ripoff of Bourne.Highly recommended in retrospect!

Review title: Female revenge? Great dialog? Gritty stunts? YES PLEASE!
Review_body: This is one of my all-time favourite action movies, simply because it doesn't follow your usual "tough-guy-beats-bad-guys-and-gets-the-girl" storyline. Geena Davis looks like an action-hero pro; as if she's never done anything else before. Excellent. Samuel L. Jackson delivers funny scenes, as well as moral support as a truly congenial guy. The villain Craig Birko is charming, handsome and evil - the perfect modern "bad guy." And little Yvonne Zima proves that there were already good child-actors at a time when the omnipresent and almighty Dakota Fanning was still soiling her nappies. Whilst 1996 was still lacking all the CG (computer generated) special effects that we are so spoilt with today, The Long Kiss Goodnight nonetheless delivers non-stop entertainment, excitement and a few laughs along the way. Watch it!

Review title: Long Kiss Goodnight - Slept on 90's action classic
Review_body: I love this movie and watch it every couple of years on DVD. I think it's one of the most slept on action thrillers of the 90's.Renny Harlin is a solid action director (Die Hard 2 & Deep Blue Sea)and you can recognise it was written by the excellent Shane Black.I think it has one of the best roles ever played by Sam Jackson, he's amazing in this as a private eye but it does have it's downpoints.1) It's a bit too long - they could have shaved off 15 minutes.2) The lead bad guy was good but David Morse is more physically imposing and would've been better in that role. Craig Bierko (too much of a pretty boy to play a badass) should've played the guy she was meant to target.3) It's not clear enough about her family - how many kids does she have? Is the guy she lives with her husband? The kid's dad? This isn't explained properly until halfway through the film.4) The story has flaws - the bad guys did not even need to get involved with trying to kill her. They could have carried out their scheme anyway.I rated this a 7/10 on IMDb, would have given it an 8 but I always struggle to watch it in one sitting. The action set pieces are cool and the dialogue is amazing. Some of the lines by Jackson are brilliant - "I'm always Frank and Earnest with women..."

I have seen this film probably a dozen times since it was originally released theatrically. Anyone who calls this movie trash or horrible just doesn't understand action films or recognize a good one. Perhaps to some the incidents and outcomes may seem far fetched, but in my opinion screenwriter Shane Black ( Lethal Weapon/ Kiss Kiss Bang Bang) crafted one of the most well thought out action adventures you will ever come across. Over the top or not this film flows like clockwork and the action just keeps coming. The final action sequence is one of the best I have ever seen in any film. The cast in this film crackles. Genna Davis gave a tremendous performance and its a damn shame there was never a "LKG" sequel. Samuel L. Jackson is hilarious as her sidekick Mitch a down on his luck private eye trying to help her discover her lost past and make a few bucks. If Baffles me how anyone could not like this film. It packs so many thrills and its so funny. The wisecracks in this film still make me laugh just as hard 10 years later. In my mind the first Matrix film and the Long Kiss Goodnight were easily 2 of the best and most original action flicks of the 90's. Incidentally Shane Black made a fortune when he sold this script. At the time it was the highest selling screenplay and its worth every penny. It's so sad that audiences never gave this movie a chance, cause they would have witnessed Renny Harlins best film and Genna Davis like you have never seen her before. Long live "The Long Kiss Goodnight"!!

I love this movie. I first saw this when it came out in the movie theaters here in the Philippines back in 1996 (I think). So when I saw this film again in Cinemax recently, I was thrilled! This probably Is the best film Renny Harlin has ever done so far. But then again, maybe the credit should be given to Shane Black who wrote the screenplay. The dialogues are fantastic! The chemistry between Charlie (Geena Davis) and Mitch (Samuel L. Jackson) is great! Here are some of my favorite lines:Charlie: I'm leaving the country, Mitch. I need a fake passport and I need money, lots of it. Mitch: Well why didn't you say so? Hold on a minute while I pull that outta my ass. Charlie: They're gonna blow my head off, you know. This is the last time I'll ever be pretty. Charlie: Were you always this stupid, or did you take lessons? Mitch Henessey: I took lessons. Mitch Henessey: ...everyone knows, when you make an assumption, you make an ass out of "u" and "umption". Mitch: So, you cold? Charlie: Yeah. Freezing. Mitch: Turn on the heat. It doesn't work, but it makes a very annoying noise - distracts from the cold. See the Memorable Quotes link for more. This film is a great watch, so don't miss it!

Geena Davis definitely shines in this movie. Both roles she plays are total opposites but she plays them phenomenally. Samuel L. Jackson, the king of one-liners, is hilarious! Review title: The greatest action-adventure film of all time
Review_body: I had thought that Renny Harlin had peaked when he directed "Cutthroat Island," one of the best movies of all time.  I was wrong.  "The Long Kiss Goodnight" exceeded even that in greatness.As in "Cutthroat Island," Geena Davis returns as the archetypal super-woman. Only this time, the catch is that she doesn't realize it.  With comic relief provided by the one, the only, Samuel L. Jackson, the two characters provide a one-two punch of movie-going madness that will rivet you in your seat until the credits roll.The greatness of the film lies in the uniquely Harlinesque balance between believability and impossibility.  What is NOT important is that he crosses this line, and in fact the viewer wants exactly that.  An example of this is when Davis shoots through the frozen lake with a machine-gun while falling from a great hight.  Now, as somebody who has gone ice-fishing on more than one occassion, I can tell you with great confidence that shooting through a lake is not going to break your fall.  But that doesn't matter!  Geena Davis can do it, and that's all that matters.  If you can allow yourself to enjoy this aspect of the movie, you will be captivated by the film and watch it many times over the years.If you liked this movie, try "Cutthroat Island" and "Tremors."

Review title: Great action movie, great Samuel L. Jackson, WONDERFUL GEENA DAVIS!
Review_body: I'm an action movie fan but until today I've never  seen a preview or an ad for this movie in Italy, so I went to see "The Long Kiss Goodnight" on pay-TV hoping for nothing special.But, what a surprise! Review title: If you enjoy the mystery and action along with excellent acting see this.
Review_body: This is a familiar genre of action / lost identity that has carved out a special niche of it's own mainly due to the performance of Geena Davis that is complemented in fine fashion by Samuel Jackson as the supporting role. It mixes Mom's apple pie sentiment with some cold blooded and well crafted action scenes that will satisfy fans of Scharzenegger and Willis movies.Geena Davis strikes a balance in a duo character that is both masterful and vulnerable and melds these two divergent personalities into one in believable fashion. This could have been hokie , but the acting is just too strong and she and Jackson are too convincing.... or is it just too much fun not to suspend your disbelief and go along for the ride. This is one of the best action films I have seen.  Geena's portrayal of the tough as nails, 'Charly'/gentle mother 'Sam', was superb and  Samuel L Jackson just keeps you laughing all the way through, with his classic one liners. Sure, there were a few holes in the actual story, but this fast-paced flick keeps you on the edge of your seat to the end.I felt Geena was a perfect choice for the role of Sam/Charly and her versatility as an actress is evident for her role as the mother in the recent movie 'Stuart Little'.  Both Samuel and Geena were well supported by David Morse, Brian Cox, sweet little Yvonne Zima and newcomers, sexy Craig Bierko, and Melina Kanakaredes. This film accentuates the growing trend of strong female character and the diversion away from traditional male/female stereotypes as we see Sam/Charly (Davis) and Mitch (Jackson) hurtling from one disaster to the next.While I and many others loved this movie, it is fair to say that there will always be people that don't and that's fine - each, to their own. I highly recommend this film to action fans, for its hilarious scenes and fast-paced action.

Review title: Geena kicks ass and Samuel saves the day
Review_body: This is a movie that was panned by critics, but it is truly one of the most enjoyable action movies of all time. Geena Davis is a schoolteacher/mom/fiancée, living a normal suburban life. The movie begins with her voice-over telling you that she woke up from a coma eight years before, with no memory of who she was. But she was pregnant, (the daughter plays a pivotal part in the movie) and she "knows" she was a schoolteacher. This was actually her alternate identity when she was a CIA agent, but that part of her memory is gone until events start happening around her that force her survival instincts and her assassin training to surface.Geena Davis is a true athlete, as evidenced by her real-life near-Olympian level archery skills. Whether she is kicking tail or getting her tail kicked, she is ultimately believable because you just know she is truly capable of doing the damn hard physical things she does. Sure there were doubles for some of the scenes, but Davis has such strength, dexterity and grace that you watch in awe as she does so much of the tough action work herself. She is all woman, and a woman with a good heart, but she has been trained to be a ruthless killer. She plays that difficult role with absolute perfection.Now team her up with Samuel L. Jackson, a low-rent private eye whom she hired as a last resort to help her find out who she really is, and you have a tremendous pairing. As her CIA persona starts surfacing, it is causing dissension in her life. At the same time Samuel Jackson lucks into some info about her. Because her persona starts fragmenting, she is desperate to learn her true identity. So she pairs up with Samuel and starts a road trip to follow up on the puzzling clues he's uncovered. It's an unlikely but ultimately very believable partnership. The dialogue is peppered with biting sarcasm, but is tempered with wit, intelligence, well-placed obscenities, and "just enough" poignance. They are wonderful together. The plot is great, and the action throughout is really first rate.This movie is basically why we bother to go to, rent or buy movies in the first place. We want to be thoroughly entertained, and The Long Kiss Goodnight does that as well as any film there is.

Review title: An action flick for viewers sick of vapid, special-effects spectacles
Review_body: I won't try to push this movie too hard but I find it nearly impossible to believe it only rates 6+ stars. I think it's too touchy-feely for your average action fan and too violent from most rom-com connoisseurs. I guess it falls into that narrow gap reserved for thrillers with snappy dialogue and just a touch of seemingly far-fetched and yet ultimately believable romance. Although I am not the kind of moviegoer who enjoys repeat viewings of a film, I have seen this movie five times over the years and it still entertains me thoroughly. Certain bits of dialogue between the two main stars are unforgettable and quotable, and while the plot may be fairly hackneyed, it contains many elements of a classic tragedy – questions of identity, revenge, uncommon heroism, and self-sacrifice – which have stood the test of time. Beyond that, it ups the ante on most action films through the brilliant comic timing of Geena Davis and Samuel Jackson, its two main leads, who are both as brutal and nonchalant with each other as a couple of teenagers.The one thing the movie clearly lacks is fancy special effects, but when a movie has great actors, great dialogue, and great fun, it hardly seems a deficiency.

Review_body: I thought this was a great action flick. A very good role for Geena Davis. She is a very versatile actress. One of my favs next to Angelina Jolie. I just saw this movie again after seeing it twice when it came out. And I'm convinced all over again that this is a great sexy action movie with wonderful dialogue, which also very smartly works to complicate and undermine gender and racial stereotypes.When the movie first came out, I was astonished that it didn't do very well. It didn't stay in the theaters long. And critics condemned the movie by writing it off as forgettable and poorly realized, rather than at least doing the movie the favor of outwardly hating it. (The most powerful way to dismiss a movie, I've realized, is to give it a middling review--hatred already suggests there is something which deserves a reaction.)
I felt and still feel The Long Kiss Goodnight is as good as any of the great and long remembered action movies, such as Terminator, Indian Jones, etc. In the end I concluded that it could only be plain misogyny that motivated the failure of this movie.The Long Kiss Goodnight, presents a powerful female lead, who is unabashed about her power, sexy, smart and doesn't renounce her power in the end (like the sad and pointless suicide in the end of Thelma and Louise). At the same time, Davis' character is not superhuman (like the "Angels" in the Charlie's Angels movies). She beats her evil (male) counterpart in The Long Kiss Goodnight not by being stronger, but by being faster, smarter, more daring, and more determined.What is more, The Long Kiss Goodnight shows Davis getting badly bruised and bleeding. This is generally a big no no with female action heroes. It's one thing if they can fight. But they still have to be pretty all the time.Also, it is one thing for a woman, in movies, to rise to an occasion (Alien, every teenage slasher movie). But usually in order to do so the woman/hero has to be chaste and she has to renounce her power in the end of the movie, returning to a more traditional role. The Charlie/Samantha character in The Long Kiss Goodnight, on the other hand, hybridizes the sexy, powerful sides of her personality with the mother, family character, and retains all of these elements.So in the end, I could only conclude that the failure of this excellent action movie had everything to do with the presentation of Davis' character. If she had been a man, this movie would be a classic (again in the vein of Terminator or Indiana Jones). But because she is an unabashedly powerful woman dealing with the difficulties of being a powerful woman in a sexist world and being good at it, the movie had to be forgotten. What a shame to realize that we live in a society that's still this misogynistic.The Long Kiss Goodnight, through Samuel Jackson's character, also does a lot to complicate racial stereotypes about black men. He is a good father who's not given a chance, but that doesn't mean he's not sexy. He's humiliated by the powers that be, but he fights back. And in the end he's duly rewarded and respected for his troubles (unlike the person of color in movies who is so often cast in a character who reforms himself but only to die--because we can't seem to imagine that a person of color deserves to live happily ever after and be rewarded for his or her troubles).What a shame that The Long Kiss Goodnight was so poorly received and never got its due. What a shame that we live in a society that is still not ready for this movie. The Long Kiss Goodnight is so much more liberated than Charlie's Angels could ever be. Why are people so afraid of respectable happy people of color and genuinely unabashedly powerful women?

How in the world this over-the-top stinker received any award nominations, let alone measurable votes here, is beyond me. It irks me that Uverse gives this three of four stars, as many as it once gave the film "Gandhi" (I'm not sure, but their ratings might be based on IMDb scoring). It's sort of trying to be what "Bourne Identity" became so much more successfully, and it failed. Davis and Jackson are wonderfully skilled actors, and it is only their performances that make this worth watching, but this vehicle is ultimately a waste of their talent. The first hour is engaging, watching Davis and Jackson develop their relationship. But once the heavy violence and action start, it goes downhill fast. The lines delivered by the little girl (Zima) came out flat and unconvincing. Worse, they were said with an adorable lisp. Bierko is equally unconvincing (and miscast) as a smirking, sarcastic, wise-cracking bad guy. The dialog is so bad, it seems like a parody of itself. In bad films like this, just before the evil genius (who has captured and is holding the hero) orders the hero to be killed, he performs a monologue revealing to the hero his reason for doing evil and his secret plan to do more evil, in order to let the audience in on the ensuing danger. You may know that scene in "Austin Powers International Man of Mystery" (a much better film than this one), when Dr. Evil says, "I'm going to place him in an easily escapable situation involving an overly elaborate and exotic death." That applies to a scene in this movie too. Most of this movie is terribly contrived, predictable, a cliché or just ridiculous. Davis is gratuitously stripped down to her underclothes in a few scenes (to nothing in one) to show off her toned body. You may not see that as a negative, as I did. I had to wonder how the bad guys didn't smell the gasoline Davis hides in the girl's doll just before the two are captured. Or why the girl waited until Davis expended all of her energy -- in a stupid and futile attempt to create a spark to ignite said gasoline by pounding on concrete with a crowbar -- and broke down in tears in frustration before she revealed to Davis that, by the way, she happened to have matches on her. How ironic and so convenient that the girl chose to hide in the very truck with the dangerous bomb that becomes involved in a high-speed chase. The scenes at the end meant to be touching are just corny. Oh, and the bloody makeup on Davis's face during the climax of the film makes her look like a crazy clown.

I loved this film. Yes, one must be willing to suspend reality for the duration, but it has, at very least, some of the best and funny lines I've ever heard. From the 'the song isn't about linen' to, most notably Brian Cox...in the first scene in which he's featured, talking to 'Alice' (btw, who was she again?) about her dog.I laugh out loud at the mere memory of BC's timing and delivery This is by far my favorite bad film :) I positively love it.Its an action film, its a comedy..its nothing serious and entirely entertaining.

Review title: A brilliant, yet incredibly flawed film
Review_body: This is one of those films that I don't know how I feel about it. The first half of the film is fantastic, the plot's fine for an action film, the action scenes are effective, and some awesome one-liners (especially from Samuel L Jackson). But then the second half comes about and destroys the set up. The plot becomes too far fetched, the one liners less frequent, and the ending is pretty anti climactic.If I watched the first half but the power went out before I could finish the film, I would be dying to see the rest of it, to see if the ending could live up to my expectations built up by the beginning. It can't. The ending is so bad, it damages the film so much so that it makes it hard for me to watch the beginning of the film because I know that the ending will let me down.I would give the first half 9/10, but the ending 6 or even 5/10. With a better ending, Long Kiss Goodnight could easily be a 10/10. Shame.

Review title: even my mom loves this film
Review_body: Geena Davis and Samuel Jackson make a great on-the-road pair trying to solve the mystery of her past before they get killed. The electricity between these actors turn this action movie into good comedy. The support cast adds great favor to the movie. It is the strangest Christmas movie I've seen and loved. I've shown it to movie fans who do not as a rule care for violence in movies, most are so taken by the story and this couple that they pass on this little gem. Samuel Jackson Fans: Samuel Jackson as Mitch the low-rent private eye is worth the viewing time alone, he manages to make the most impossible situations real, terrifying and funny.

Review title: Quality film with action and classic one liners to boot!
Review_body: The film begins with a slow start that leaves you wondering whether you picked up the right video from the store, but the plot quickly develops into a action fans dreamland. Although some of the sequences were a little far fetched, Geena Davis pulls off both of her alter-egos with class and Samuel Jackson provides us with comic relief and a supporting character which adds a depth to the movie. From the fake prostitute and detectives to 'CHARLY' skating on ice while picking off guys, this movie hits the big notes. The only criticism I and my mother also pointed out when she watched it was 'CHARLY's DAUGHTER' saying that she hit her head when her mother just went through hell. I know that was the point of that scene but I don't feel it was nailed sufficiently to capture the moment for the viewers to cause them to start throwing popcorn at the television in some futile attempt to get her off the screen!Due to the daughter not being a huge character the movie receives a ten out of ten score every time.
This should be on the top of your Christmas viewing list along with Die Hard.
Fantastic movie, even when I see it for the 10th time!
One of the best action and christmas movies, definitly underrated.

Review title: Davis and Jackson are much better than this...
Review_body: I know that most action movies follow some sort of formula, but The Long Kiss Goodnight takes the formula and does what Coke did with their formula in the 80s... tried to improve upon it, and just made it worse.I did see this on cable, so there was some cutting and swear-bleeping involved, but I really think that adding all of what they took out could possibly have made this a better film. I was all excited to see it too... saw the listing in the TV guide, made myself a bowl of popcorn, and curled up in front of the TV waiting to be entertained. Disappointment was achieved not even 10 minutes into the movie. It seemed to take forever to "set up" the plot, cutting 4 or 5 scenes at the beginning of the film right before you find out what a character is about, or what his motivation is. The Long Kiss Goodnight seems to revel in making you believe that a character is a good guy, only to reveal very shortly thereafter that he indeed is a bad guy, or vice versa.And the clichés! If I might borrow a phrase from my Jewish friends, oy vey. Yet another film that reveals that one hit to the head results in amnesia, and another gets your memory back. (Has a real-life amnesia sufferer ever tried this in real life? I wonder if it works...) And of course, the frumpy schoolteacher Davis was at the beginning of the movie was in stark contrast to the CIA-trained hit-woman she used to be. As clearly evidenced by her decision to cut her hair and dye it blonde. (I know that the dramatic hair changing scene always means transformation... see also "The Legend Of Billie Jean", or "The Banger Sisters" or "Sleeping With The Enemy" or... well, you see where I'm going with this) More cliché... the ever-present Dirty Harry-type line spoken right into the camera just before shooting someone; the torture scene featuring a camisole-and-panties-clad Geena Davis (who obviously had undergone rigorous weight-training before filming) strapped seductively to a water wheel; the slow-motion (and again "wet") Geena Davis and Sam Jackson emerging from the frozen pond, alive! I have long been an admirer of both Davis and Jackson... as far as I'm concerned, Geena has always made good decisions in her roles, and Jackson always manages to make himself look like he's better than some of the bad movies he's been in. I would swear, at times, Davis seems to be well aware of the fact that a certain line or scene she's doing is pure schlock, but thinks maybe she can make it better with her fine performance. Wrong, Geena. This was just bad material that the finest actor could not make look better.All in all, don't waste your time with this one. Unless you;re one of those people who LIKES to watch bad movies with your friends and just laugh at how bad they are. In that case, get this DVD as soon as you can!!!
